Class GUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • GUI

  • public class GUI
extends java.lang.Object
    A GUI written in Java Swing which wraps around a Game instance. Is used to get a graphical view of the data in a Game.
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Nikolaj Ignatieff Schwartzbach

      Width and height of the inner window, in pixels

      The current game speed (0 = stop, 1 = slow, .. )

      Width and height of the inner window, in pixels

        Returns:
        A JPanel containing some buttons to control the game

      • createGameBoard

        public static void createGameBoard()
        Starts the game.

      • createMenuBar

        public javax.swing.JMenuBar createMenuBar()
        Creates the menubar which contains two menus: Game menu and log menu. Game menu has entires for: New game, shortcut: Ctrl+Shift+N, Pause/resume game, shortcut: Ctrl+Shift+P, Abort game, shortcut: Ctrl+Shift+A, Options..., shortcut: Ctrl+Shift+O, Set speed, a menu that contains buttons to change the speed of the game, a shortcut is Ctrl+[1;4] where 1 is slowest and 4 is fastest. Log Menu has entreis for: Play log..., shortcut: Ctrl+Shift+L, Save log..., shortcut: Ctrl+Shift+S
        Returns:
        a JMenuBar containing two menus to control the game.

      • createOptionsDialogBox

        public javax.swing.JFrame createOptionsDialogBox()
        Creates the JFrame which represents the Options...-menu.
        Returns:
        A JFrame representing the Options...-menu.

        public void setSpeed(int speed)
        Changes the game speed
        Parameters:
        speed - The new speed of the game. 0 <= speed <= 4
